content.title: ALI Rutherford Classification
content.definition: Rutherford classification: I (viable), IIa (threatened-marginal), IIb (threatened-immediate), III (irreversible).
content.statement: ALI Rutherford Classification is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Acute-Limb-Ischemia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding ALI Rutherford Classification helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of ALI Rutherford Classification include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of ALI Rutherford Classification.

clinical_pearls: Key point about ALI Rutherford Classification
